physicalDescription.extent: 1 item (photograph), 10 x 8 inches, black and white
physicalDescription.note: On envelope: ''# 114 Charles Schayer Store. See oversize on museum display''. On back of the photograph: ''Charles Schayer, an Jewish German immigrant arrived in Denver 1865. The 4th generation of Schayer's still resides in Denver, Schayer Store, #114.'' Printed on the bottom of the photograph: "C.M. Schayer, wholesale dealer in liquors, wines and cigars, 409 Blake Street, Denver, Col."

mods.abstract: Exterior of the C.M. Schayer Store owned by Charles M. Schayer, with a sign posted at the top of the building. Eight unidentified men and children stand in front and on a balcony. The store was located at 409 Blake Street in Denver, Colorado. Schayer arrived in Denver by covered wagon in 1865.
mods.note: Appears in ''Images of America: Jewish Denver 1859-1940,'' by Dr. Jeanne Abrams, page 19.
Donated by Mr. Charles Schayer, Jr. in 1977.
